TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ConsoleError extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Describes a page error that resulted from authoring or editing operations.

remarks.para: When an error has occurred during the postback event of a ConsoleAction, the error can be displayed to the user, along with recommended actions. This object contains the text of the error message and the associated ConsoleNode (which contains the list of recommended actions).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: String that represents the text message to be conveyed to the user.
Docs.summary: Returns an instance of the ConsoleError class with a text message set to a specified value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.WebControls.ConsoleNode actions) cil managed
Public Sub New (message As String, actions As ConsoleNode)

Docs.param: String that represents the text message to be conveyed to the user.
ConsoleNode for which each child ConsoleNode represents an action to be suggested to the user in context of the error.
Docs.summary: Returns an instance of the ConsoleError class with a text message set to a specified value; includes suggested actions for the user to perform.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Actions As ConsoleNode

Docs.summary: Actions that should be displayed as part of this error message.
Docs.value: A ConsoleNode that represents the list of actions to suggest to the user.

remarks.para: At the end of the error message, a list of suggested actions can be optionally displayed. If, for example, a user tries to check out a page that is checked out by another user, a suggested action might be "Override Checkout." You can specify the suggested actions by creating a root ConsoleNode and adding as child ConsoleNodes each action that you want to display to the user.
This ConsoleNode is the root of a two-level hierarchy, and its ChildConsoleNodes are the actions that will be presented to the user.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Message As String
public: property System::String ^ Message { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Message for the user, including a description or additional details about the error that occurred.
Docs.value: A string that represents a message for the user.
